channel.title: Change group id in /etc/group
channel.description:
I need to change the numerical value for a group (oracle) to 106.
But this will obviously break a bunch of ownership between files Anyone can help me write a script that goes through the file system and outputs the full path of any file that has the group id oracle?

item.title: Change group id in /etc/group
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

After you modify the groups file:

I think it will work, but you should try it on an isolated set of files firstâ€¦

I think you will have to grab the list of files before you change /etc/group and store it in a file, then run chgrp after you switch the group id

[code]find / -group oracle -print0 > oracles.txt

edit /etc/group

cat oracles.txt | xargs -0 chgrp oracle[/code]

Read full topic
